EXISTING STRUCTURES
─────────────────────
### Copper Cable Factory at position (≈2.5, 17.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• Burner inserter placed at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) (dedicated factory burner inserter using direction RIGHT)
• A second factory burner inserter noted at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
• Assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5) connected as a neighbour to the burner inserters

Use-case: This structure forms the interface for converting copper inputs into copper cable production by routing items from the input chest through burner inserters into processing machinery.

### Belt Depot for Extraction System at position (≈3.5, 15.5)
Consists of the following entities:
• Wooden chest placed at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5) serving as the depot
• Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) positioned adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) (using direction UP) with a pickup position at (3.5, y=15.5) and drop position at (3.5, y=13.5)

Use-case: This structure is designed to act as an intermediary belt depot that receives items (from the extraction system) and prepares them for further transport into processing areas.

### Extraction System at position (≈–3.5, 27.5)
Consists of the following entity:
• Extraction system burner inserter at Position(x=–3.5, y=27.5) with its drop position at (–3.5, y=28.5)

Use-case: This component is responsible for extracting items from the source area and providing an output drop for transport via multi‐segment belts.

ERROR TIPS
───────────
• When connecting transport belts, the target entity must be a valid inserter rather than a Prototype.SteamEngine. Before attempting a belt connection, verify the target’s type and, if necessary, place an appropriate inserter to serve as the proper input.
• When placing entities (e.g. wooden chests), ensure that the player is within the allowed placement range. Check that the distance between the player’s current position and the target position does not exceed the maximum permitted distance.
• Confirm that required items (such as a wooden chest) are available in the inventory before placing them.
• Validate all variable names and references (for instance, avoid undefined names like “target_chest”) to prevent NameErrors and ensure proper code referencing.
